topic.title: ZeroNet Mobile Feature Request
topic.body:
I was working on ZeroNet Mobile app for Android with Latest py3 branch from scratch.
If you're interested you can download latest version at 
https://github.com/canewsin/ZeroNet/releases/latest

If you want some specific feature request post as a comment if i think it is neccessary or if your comment gets more upvotes i will add that feature in the app.

Already Planned :
- Windowless Background Operation
- Autorun feature
- Users.json backup or restore
- ZeroNet Code Patching until changes got merged into official
- Custom Data Folder Location
- Tor Support if Possible (no gurantee ðŸ˜›)

http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1578171588_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd

topic.title: Just Performed Flutter Clock Challege.
topic.body:
Digital Clock
Flutter Clock is an implementation of a digital clock in Flutter. It has a light theme and a dark theme.

It has 3 Types Clock in it.

Digital Clock.
Binary Clock.
Text Clock.
Digital Clock will show time as normal clock, but it does not end there, digital clock has circles on it, these shows numbers in binary format, and another clock is text clock, which shows time in text format, not just that. it wishes every minute, just like other digital clocks it has weather and day details. If you are a techy, you will like the clock with binary language. It has ticker in the middle, ticker seems like climbing dots or snake animation, but they are implemented using binary digits, for unknown people they seems like an animation but for known people it will entertain meaningfully. Weather details update every 20 secs covering Avg, Min, Max temperatures as well as weather condition.

Benifits :

Its code is optimised for smart clocks which have less powerful chips and ram resources.
Contains both light and dark themes.
Simple and modern design.
design is familiar to most smart clocks.

Video : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lk-fFNvEX1E
Repo : https://github.com/canewsin/flutter_clock/tree/master/digital_clock

topic.title: Had an Idea about creating fork of ZeroNet for ZeroNet Mobile.
topic.body:
As you may all know, I was developing zeronet mobile for several months, i was carefully watching the pull request increase for ZeroNet core, but nofish is out of communication for several months, i was planning to make a fork to speed up development process, as a pilot project, i will create a fork for ZeroNet Mobile, and give an option to use what repo they prefer in ZeroNet Mobile App to use. during this process i will consider the active developers of repo to accept the pull requests. if this makes difference in quality of the app further, i can proceed further to release the Desktop runner for other platforms.

As a community, i want all of your opinions to move further.

topic.body:
This is the right time to save our community, we need to educate others, why free speech is necessary, 
if we discuss our self in ZeroNet about future of it, it makes no difference, so put your leg outside and promote in most user reaching platforms.

Use your own words use tags like #FreeSpeech #ZeroNet #ZeroNetMobile or you may retweet at https://twitter.com/PramukeshVenky/status/1424282897742139394, it doesn't matter which platform you use, it's only matters how much you made the difference.

translate this post to other language forums, so that all our community members will support us.

topic.title: Post Known ZeroNet Proxy Sites here.
Crypto Naming System - DNS Like Proof of Work Naming System
topic.body:
DNS is successful due to human readable naming system and their records liking with their servers in centralised source. But for decentralised network accessing, outside the network is not preferable by its users, namecoin systems exists for a reason with blockchain, which is no go users because we have store namecoin blockchain, since it is not just related to zeronet, it is huge in size and sharing huge amount of namecoin full blockchain data is not feasible. Also few services like domain data stores exists eg: name.yo etc, but outside the zeronet, we cannot verify the integrity of the domain. Other services like vanitygen exists for semi readable names, we should have DNS like Name System for cryptography area. Thus I drafted a solution for this problem, and made a software CryptoNS-gen, currently it's just a prototype, but for testing it works for now for you to test it, main idea is bitcoin addresses are random, we can produce as many as we want possibly millions in seconds if we use GPUs, user has to give a domain name. Program has predefined patterns, the goal of program is to create a bitcoin address which satisfies one of the predefined patterns, currently program runs on cpu instructions only thus is very slow but you can have 5 letter domain names, but once GPU computing is involved, speed will increase up to 100X, thus we can produce longer domain names, program will output bitcoin address and private key, pattern, domain, since we can reproduce domain from address and pattern, we will have an integrity of address. Currently like vanitygen, CryptoNS-gen is just a address gen thus it doesn't store domain names and addresses, so don't expect it store your domain linking, since domain names are verifiable we can just store in database like ZeroName like sites and retrive them, POW in this context is longer the domain, longer it can take to generate, "DNS like" here refers to we have to store these values by linking address and domain or username with a pattern at some place. Since domain and address are linked with pattern, we can ensure there can be only one unique domain is registered across such service provider.

Program is written using rust, if you're interested, you can hack into source code.
Source Code : https://github.com/decentnetwork/CryptoNS-Gen
Binary Release : https://github.com/decentnetwork/CryptoNS-Gen/releases/tag/0.0.1

Example :
windows : 
> cryptons_gen.exe zero

```
result : zero took : 56 secs, pattern: P
pattern : P
public key : 1KZeRrzouETELHti43jtCT2Xi4pqxgB6Su
private key : 5KPZpcXvz3QkCAzPJM5fVapB677aTAkJM3BBFQibahTRiu8V7SM
```

v 0.0.2
```
result : zero took : 1 secs, pattern: NF
elapsed time in secs 1
pattern : NF
public key : 1Ld6Z5eRYoUeVinrAcrbxBZUmLCG9F88c9
private key : KwsWGb7ASba8ZmNexrbuhdEtUFTH4bG212d7vneHfrzog6cgmywL
```

Your feedback is appreciated.

topic.title: Testers Needed For New Decentralised Network in Coming Days.
topic.body:
As I previously said about drafting new Decentralized Network, Currently Implementing that. In coming days, I will test communication protocol for that. If you're interested let me know. If implementation is successful, communication layer for zeronet will be replaced by this new transport layer.
Contribute : If you are able provide a VPS server to me, it will be helpful for more peers. VPS is required until network gets some considerable active peers at initial stage. After that we can avoid VPS in later communication.

topic.title: Try Zerolink.ml A New Proxy for ZeroNet
How to Contribute to ZeroNet via VPS at $5 per Month or Free for 60 Days.
topic.body: I currently working on Decentralized Protocol for Next Generation P2P Services and Apps. While exploring resources to that project, I came across a VPS Provider Digital Oceans, which offers VPS at as low as $5/month, which is negligible when compared to others and you can host full linux server for that money. You will get 1vCPU/1GB Ram/25GB Hard Disk Space. You can also get $100 Free Credit to use within 60 days, so that you don't have to pay for first 60 days. Service needs a credit card/paypal a/c with $5, paypal users have to pay on signup, credit card users need not to pay upfront. So try your self, ping me if you have any doubts.

topic.title: ZeroNet Forking in Progress, Any Objections ?
topic.body:
Hello Guys, I held enough to get reply from @nofish but didn't get any. Most of the ZeroNet installations are disconnecting from the network, they either don't know how to make code changes to core or loosing interest in the project. What's you thoughts on this.

First Plans:
Fork ZeroNet, Add TOR patch.
Educate New Users about new source.
Allow Modified Pull Requests which are not accepted to Original Repo.
Enable Existing Plugins which support to strengthen the network by default.

Further Improvements :
Plugin Store to host plugins submitted by Users for Better Extension of App.
Translation Service Providers to provide translations for all languages. Translation Stores similar to above.
Improved Versions of Default Sites.
Attract more content creators into the platform.


Future:
Improve Core.
Portability to more Platforms.

These TODOs are planned few months back, but hesitated to post, there are more like these. 
@nofish @styromaniac@kxoid.bit @ssdifnskdjfnsdjk @GitCenter @geekless @lola
I will tag more people, tag more known developers, users or contributors you know.

1617873274_1Nv7HrYvwPjyGyx6iUG7KZrj4TNdu.body:
i was currently drafting a next gen p2p network. code is not released yet but soon will be published with specs and white paper. 
link useful to track project https://github.com/decentnetwork

> [pelosis4jail](#comment_12_18KNX9hqqZ2ssi7DYGLcRNSCcwjQTMjc4Q): with censorship embedded or individual moderation, like here, aka muting?

censorship is hard on p2p, but with some content filtering options like auto-use filters from trusted parties will block most of the spam, i was building an infrastructure instead of an application, so that devs can built services upon it, so a dev can make, an ai that can auto detect a spam and hide, but shown to user that post is hidden, thus giving the user power to show whats in it.

soon i will publish a blog in zeronet about the project, even though i made a ZeroNet Mobile client, i didn't dive much into core itself, thus i was currently digging the ZeroNet core code, which helps in stated project, like cryptography used in ZeroNet.

> [nohidie](#comment_107_1Gg1sTkqAaXfMmVVG6yghf3FF8D3RJuChf): I just say that if you don't know who the AI bans, you may miss some interesting content to you :).

that's where show hidden posts comes into play, so that user can view, whether content is spam or not, problem of muting is content from a person is completely made invisible, but some may continue to use same id to post normal stuff in future, even though those post are not spam we cannot read those content because of muting. suppose user can config a weights for spam posts, if a spammer reaches such limit may completely hidden from discussions.  
Initial implementation like for example in github issues/discussions some comments can be marked as irrelevant by author of issue/pull request/discussion, thus comment will be marked as non relevant for discussion, but user can view at his will, which is much powerful than muting here.

1627640020_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
i recently updated ZeroNet Mobile with ZeroTalk++, Code Migration was Successful, 
Steps I Followed are - 
1. First Clone ZeroTalk(Since ZeroNet Mobile is based on that.) for Temp Site Testing.
2. Create Some Posts and Comments.
3. Opened ZeroNet++ Site and Copied index.html, js/all.js, css/all.css, fonts/...
4. Manually Modified content.json, mostly site settings.
5. Upgraded Temp Site Code.
6. Since There are some styling issues with site on dark mode.
7. manually added or removed some styling and js etc.
8. Once i was satisfied, i copied all code in step 3 to ZeroNet Mobile after modification and Upgrade Code on ZeroHello.

Result: [ZeroNet Mobile](/15UYrA7aXr2Nto1Gg4yWXpY3EAJwafMTNk)
Also, I used ZeroTalk++ git repo at first, there are some issues with that, so this is the best solution, i found.

```
  "cert_signers": {
   "kxoid.bit": ["12F5SvxoPR128aiudte78h8pY7mobroG6V","18Mt3CWBpiqJBLsPSu5JxB4B9MeaSwhyJ"],
   "zeroid.bit": ["1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz"]
  },
```
your site/data/users/content.json should be like this to allow other id providers.

1627760364_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_3189_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I guess I can confirm that this works. I don't know why my phone is able to reach it though. [...]

since tor, which is shipping with zeronet mobile is already new, it will support tor v3 addresses, thus zeronet just need to know address of v3 peers. it will communicate further, but to create it self as a tracker or suppose to communicate with other onion peers zeronet queries the tor to get own address to send to other peers, this is where tor v3 patch is required. currently i was planning to release v3 patch in next version, almost 60% clients will be patched, as data i collected form playstore, previously, i informed in other thread about [forking the project](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1628310919_12sCaEUFqE6g3JrDqmEA8pn9yrgxwkZQMe), if had positive response from community, i will further release other platform runners (eg: windows, linux etc.), thus upgrading the most of clients.

Already planned that.

1628395676_1AmXimBQuPemuoTM9NFYg9Mn5YY6H.body: What a coincidence, currently working on CryptoNamingSystem from the past week, DNS like POW naming system, hope it will solve current problems, soon publish a post on ZeroTalk about it.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1500_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Amazing! Is it based on blockchain as well? I'd love to test it, if you're going to run a beta test.

It doesn't require blockchain to work, but service provider like name.yo service may use blockchain to store the domains or ZeroName like service can store those domains in simple names.json file and serve them.

it's like vanitygen but with mathematical patterns, instead of bitcoins, CryptoNS-gen mines bitcoin addresses to match domain with certain mathematical pattern(not limited, we can use any pattern) in address. once successful match is found, it gives domain/username based on service provider(ZeroName/ZeroId), private public key and pattern name. The user has to do himself all this process of mining and submit the domain, pattern, pubkey to service providers like ZeroName,Name.YO to register, The service providers have to ensure not to allow duplicate domains.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1501_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Ah, so the duplicate problem is not resolved? Unfortunate.

uniqueness of public address and domain in linked with pattern, here is an example
```
result : zero took : 56 secs, pattern: P
pattern : P
public key : 1KZeRrzouETELHti43jtCT2Xi4pqxgB6Su
private key : 5KPZpcXvz3QkCAzPJM5fVapB677aTAkJM3BBFQibahTRiu8V7SM
```

service provider has to use these details to add these to domain records.

ZeroName retrives domains from namecoin which is a blockchain, Name.Yo is like form to fill domains and address but we cannot determine a domain name from address with pattern, how do name.yo deals with conflicts, its just checks its db whether domain is registered or not, currently i was working on CNS-gen, thus generator part only, for current zeronet dns problems, i thought it would be better than other solutions.

Yes, it will be extensible to any protocol, I'm making it as modular as possible. currently working on transport, once transport is done, there will be decent protocol(base), It can extended with other protocols like zeronet, tor etc., then there will be I/O stuff. After that apps/websites/services etc.

1637164951_1FmMvcMgGyFnWtH3aSAHmaxwedbBR.body: when zeronet.now.im is active, it grabbed as almost 45000+ seed for ZeroHello and 40000+ for ZeroNet Mobile. But don't know the reason, it was done few days back. To test this congestion I created a public proxy my self here http://zerolink.ml. ZeroNet is being used by people around world and more to come in coming days. Major issues are portability and lack of proper strategy in data sharing between peers. Due to this there are data lose issues occurred here and there.

1637214620_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8B.body:
> [anonymoose](#comment_54_12Y8rPJTMwJ3tTh5j81JPy6HrMf4KvY6Uq): I would [...]
Yeah, It's same thought from my side, Unlike Other binary distribution formats python code can be updated on the run so, it's better to hold such type of development on ZeroNet itself, instead on clearnet. In decentnet project, I drafted a protocol that works in this way, since people can contribute to an open-source project unlike on clearnet sites where only code repo owner can set who can acts as contributors to the repo to auto merge changes, protocol handovers the power to the active community, suppose developers like nofish disappears into thin air, based on contributions made by the other users, they will get a score to proceed the work from there, without user need to change the project code source or if project is abandoned, developers can push their code to same repo, users are free to choose the these code updates, more users get their hands on them, better its distributions work.

Other things like Protocol Extensions(as mentioned here) will be released with in White Paper after Protocol Standardization.
